attributes.description: Crude oil is separated into its components at a refinery. This refinery heats the oil so that it becomes gaseous and the send the gas up through distillation columns. The gas cools as it travels up, turning back into liquid. Since different component oils turn liquid at different temperatures, the different liquids are drawn out at different heights. Sources: http://www.fpcc.com.tw/English/product/production%20process.htm
attributes.title: Petrochemical Plant
Nolan Helmet Factory
attributes.address: Brembate di Sopra Province of Bergamo, Italy

attributes.title: Bisphenol A (BPA) Factory
attributes.description:
BPA has the highest volume production of any chemical worldwide. (6 billion pounds/year) It is a synthetic chemical compound made in factories. It is a key monomer in the creation of polycarbonates and is often found in canned food lining, CDs or DVDS, plastic food containers, dental fillings and sealants, receipts, etc. (The list goes on and on.) 

BPA has been found to mimic estrogen in the human body, affecting: brain development, behavior, prostate glands, mammary glands, thyroid function, cancer risk, heart disease, diabetes and pre-natal development (leading to birth defects). 

Research is currently focused on the effect BPA-containing products can have consumers, but a recent study has shown men who work in factories which use BPA may have a lower sperm count as wells as sperm which moves abnormally.


Sources:
http://www.baumhedlundlaw.com/bpa/what_is_bpa.ph
http://simplehomemade.net/bpa-what-it-is-where-it-is-what-to-do/
http://www.npr.org/blogs/health/2010/10/28/130888233/a

attributes.title: Phosgene Plant
attributes.description:
Phosgene is produced by passing purified carbon monoxide and chlorine gas through a bed of porous activated carbon (the activated carbon acts as a catalyst)

Phosgene is an extremely toxic poison which was used as a chemical weapon during WWI. It causes suffocation but acts slowly and has an odor which may not be quickly noticed. Phosgene detection badges are worn by those at risk of exposure.

Sources: 
http://wikimapia.org/10457620/Phosgene-plant
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phosgene

attributes.title: SABIC Innovative Plastics Factory
attributes.description:
SABIC Innovative Plastic's biggest plant is in Indiana where Lexan brand polycarbonate plastic is made. 

Polycarbonate plastics are highly versatile because they are easily worked and molded. They are created by the reaction of bisphenol A (BPA) and phosgene.

Polycarbonates are often used for: electronic sensors, helmets, shields, aircraft & missile components, household appliances, etc.

Sources: 
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polycarbonate
http://www.icis.com/Articles/2007/11/06/9076146/polycarbonate-uses-and-market-data.html
